name: Hotel Orto De Medici

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Orto de Medici for 4 nights---and it was FABULOUS! Everything about this hotel was perfect--the location, the room, the breakfast....EVERYTHING! WHen we checked in, we were told we were upgraded and that was a nice surprise after a long train ride! The room was incredible....huge with a brand new bathroom and a terrace that had a fantastic view of Florence and the Duomo. It could not have been better. The breakfast room was nice and relaxing, and you could even sit out on the terrace and enjoy!
reviews.title: One of our Favorites!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Everything is within walking distance--the train station, the Accademia, Duomo, Uffizi, Ponte Vecchio..it was terrific. I highly recommend this hotel...you will LOVE it!
reviews.title: CHARMING LITTLE GEM

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Great Place! We booked through the hotels website and were pleasantly surprised to find the hotel was all it had been made out to be.
reviews.title: A jewel tucked into Florence.

likes.liked: — Pleasant staff, linen sheets, cleanliness, location, great breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel is centrally located close to all the tourist attractions yet in a quiet environment.
reviews.title: Double thumbs up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night in the Superior Room and the standard room. The views of Florence and its environs from the Superior room balcony were great. The rooms were very well appointed and were clean and spacious.
reviews.title: Lovely and very ideally placed hotel

likes.disliked: — The shower was better thank most but all Italian showers we find leak all over the floor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: We loved this hotel. The service is excellent: friendly, courteous, and always helpful. The deluxe accommodations are outstanding both in the main building and in the new building (the new rooms are sleek and elegant). The breakfast has a fresh and varied selection and excellent coffee. It is served in a beautiful orangerie-type of room with lovely paintings on the walls. In warmer weather the terrace is open as well. The terrace overlooks a peaceful garden that adds to the sense of respite after a long day of sightseeing or business. The hotel is well situated; it's just around the corner from the Accademia Museum and the Piazza San Marco where you can catch a bus or taxis at any time.
reviews.title: The Orto de' Medici is centrally located, peaceful, gracious, and lovely.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: You can easily walk to all of the main tourist attractions from this conveniently located hotel. Piazza San Marco is just a block away with a famous monastery, restaurants, café, drug store,and buses that lead you in all kinds of directions.
reviews.title: Don't hesitate!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has an old section and a remodeled section. We had a room in the old section which we preferred to keep after checking out a remodeled room mainly due to the magnificent view. Some of the furniture was worn out, but the bed was comfortable and everything was very clean. All of the public areas of the hotel were beautifully decorated. Unfortunately, the plaster (frescoes) along the dining room walls is badly chipped.because the tables and chairs are too crowded. There was a good variety of food served at breakfast. I would have preferred real Italian coffee, but it was okay.The staff is very professional and pleasant. This hotel offers you great value for your money.
reviews.title: so accomodating!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: the orto dei medici is a beautiful small hotel located about 10 min walk from the duomo. the rooms were beautiful and very clean, breakfast was well stocked and had alot to choose from. we were there when the volcano erupted and they easily and without question accomodated us for 6 more nights. a very lovely hotel with a beautiful terrace. i would recommend it highly.
reviews.title: Could this be the perfect hotel?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was our second stay at the Orto de Medici in the past six months. Both times we stayed in one of newly-remodeled deluxe rooms. They are incredibly spacious with bathrooms as big as some hotel rooms. The staff at the front desk is always polite, the breakfast staff is cheery, and the hotel is centrally located in Firenze, just a 15 minute walk from the train station. And, to top it off, the hotel is quiet. Each morning we were awakened by the birds in the central garden.
reviews.title: We like it very much

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were nicely decorated with high ceilings and a comfortable bed .. the bedroom was sectioned off from the dressing room to ensure a peaceful rest.. I enjoyed the complementary newspaper and book about the Medici family.
reviews.title: Tastefully Decorated Comfortable Hotel .. w/ Accomadating Gestures

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely dining area and patio. Continental breakfast; coffee, tea, pastries, cereal, fruit, cookies, etc. Large outdoor seating area and fountain.. The roses will be gorgeous in bloom..
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The complimentary use of computers was handy to check email and train times.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Front desk staff was helpful directions and accommodating.
reviews.title: Definitely a highlight of our trip to Italy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010
reviews.text: We arrived by train from Rome and decided on a cab to the hotel. We decided on a day trip to Sienna and walked to the Sita bus depot next to the train station. Great day trip!
reviews.title: No Place Like it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I can't say enough about the excellent hotel staff at this hotel. They were always warm and welcoming and ready to help. The hotel is well located within walking distance to the duomo, etc. It was very clean, pleasant and quiet at night!
reviews.title: Great hotel staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose Hotel Orto De'Medici after reading the reviews from Trip Advisor. I wanted a place that was quiet, clean, and private bathroom. The hotel lobby has been remodeled and it's very "modern". For me, it didn't feel homey....then we headed up stairs to our room, opened the door and it was a completely different atmosphere! Very large room and was decorated with venetian antiques Loved it! Beautiful view of the gardens and very quiet. Centrally located, which was great as we like to walk every where. Bathroom was nice, except, there was no shower curtain and water got all over the floor. That is my only complaint. Service was very nice. Asked for an extra pillow and it was there within minutes. I'd definitely return to this hotel.
reviews.title: Hotel Orto De' Medici was very comfortable with excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Loved this hotel! The location was great- within walking distance to just about everything, fantastic restaurants nearby. The staff was wonderful!! Everyone at the front desk went out of their way to help us. I can't say enough about how wonderful the staff was. The room was spacious and quiet. A great find!
reviews.title: Amazing staff!
Wonderful Boutique hotel with wonderful service!
reviews.text: My college age daughter and I spent a week in Italy and stayed at the Hotel Orto De Medici. What a fabulous place! The room was incredible. Ask for the newly renovated rooms as they are spacious even by american standards. Very clean and the staff is very helpful, cheerful and friendly. Nice contintental breakfast. The hotel is located near all the sights but not on a main street where you will hear all the traffic. No more than a 10-15 minute walk to any of the major sightseeing locations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010
reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Florence and likes the atmosphere a smaller hotel with authentic Tuscan beauty! thank you Hotel Orto DeMedici fo making my stay a memorable one. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Florence!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: many people I've met were slightly dissapointed about Firenze, as the city doesn't have the romantic flair you might expect, althougth it has beauty in abundance, way more then any other city. In most cases it's hidden behind a facade. It's a brilliant place, and i can higly recommend it, but if there's anything that does indeed live up to the expectations of a renaissance place, it's this orto de medici. It's a great location for whoever seeks to visit the city's nucleus. I would recommend a taxi from the staion to the hotel (+/- 11 €) unless you don't mind towing your luguage through a less appealing neighbourhood for about 15 minutes.
reviews.title: get the Firenze feeling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel is charming, well maintained, nice atmosphere, and a helpful and friendly staff (though you might see several different faces at the reception in one day...) The rooms are nicely decorated, there's a good and clean bathroom, and the breakfast is far above Italian average (but still below Brittish and German), with a buffet and served in both a breakfast salon and a little terrace. If there's rumour in the hotel, it's not coming from the street outside, but from other high heeled guests, and from from the old style doors, which look very nice, but can by no means be shut quietly.
reviews.title: Superb boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Over all, a highly recommended place for travellers seeking to visit the art treasures of Firenze, and who don't need marble in every room, but prefer a touch of authenticity and warm, refined, style.
reviews.title: Absolutely Lovely!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My companion and I booked this hotel for a 4 night stay in February through Expedia. We were pleased to see so many good reviews on Tripadvisor and indeed the hotel lived up to these good reviews.
reviews.title: Loved this Hotel!!!!!!!!!!

likes.liked: — Quiet location and the beautiful terrace.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008
reviews.text: We had each booked a double room for single occupancy and were delighted to see what fabulous rooms they were. Mine had a lovely little balcony surrounded with boxes of herbs and my friend's room had an enormous bathroom. Both rooms had fabulous views over the rooftops. The room decor was of an excellent standard and the beds very comfortable. The bedding was sheets and blankets rather than a duvet so I was concerned that I might be cold in the night, it being February. However I turned up the thermostat on the wall a little and was plenty warm enough. The bathroom was of an excellent standard and in very good working order. My only criticism was that there was a rather strong smell of bleach, and I wasn't sure if this was coming from the water itself or the drains. We both had extremely dry skin when we returned to the UK so I suspect it was something to do with the water in the hotel.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay spoiled by careless staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Orto De Medici for three nights as part of our Italian vacation. We loved everything about this hotel.
reviews.title: Great Choice!

likes.liked: — The staff and the size of the room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The staff was so helpful in securing reservations, answering our questions and just being overall friendly in every way. Each day we would ask for directions or suggestions and they were always willing to help.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was just far enough from the Duomo to not feel like you were being mobbed by people, but only took about 10 minutes to walk to the Duomo. It is also just around the corner from a main bus stop and taxi stand.
reviews.title: What a hidden gem!

likes.disliked: — The thought that others might discover it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our room was very spacious and a perfect temperature. It was very warm when we were in Florence, so we cooled the room off with the air conditioner. While it does not run while you are out of your room (you must have your key in for electricity) it would cook off in about 10 minutes when back in the room.
reviews.title: Great Location

likes.liked: — The ambience and the historic feeling of the building and it's location.
likes.disliked: — The pillows were like rocks and the bar closed at 8pm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We enjoyed breakfast each morning and there was plenty for all tastes. Our first night there we also had a drink on the garden terrace which was very relaxing and a nice added treat. Since we were only there 3 days, we only got to enjoy this one evening, but wished we had again.
reviews.title: Excellent location
Loved this Charming Hotel
reviews.text: I loved this Hotel, The rooms were comfortable and clean, the breakfast made a great start to your day of site seeing, and a drink on the terrace in the evening was wonderful before venturing out for something to eat.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Full of Charming character, as is Florence its self, and in a great location (Florence is pretty compact) I loved the wonderful ceilings with their sparkling chandeliers
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This can be an expensive city to eat in, we found Za Za restaurant pretty reasonable, with good food, although the reviews on it seem a bit hit and miss. And there are some bargains to be had from the local painters who work in the Doumo Square
reviews.title: Very Pleasant Surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You will not be disapointed with this Charming Hotel
reviews.title: Excellent, well-situated, nice surroundings and very central.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoy!
reviews.title: Lovely, centrally located hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 5 days in Sept 2008. The hotel has been fully refurbished in recent years and is stylishly appointed. It is well located, within easy walking distance of the main attractions (do not try to keep a car in Florence). The room was a reasonable size and clean, but sound insulation can be a bit weak (e.g. plumbing), and the half bath was slightly bizarre. The staff were all very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Stylish hotel close to centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chose this hotel through reviews by others, and was extremely pleased by the location, the staff, and the general atmosphere. This was my first time in Italy, and staying at Orto de Medici felt just like home, and was sunny, bright and utterly charming. Close to San Marco square and busses, but on a quiet charming street. Loved it, loved it, loved it!
reviews.title: Loved this special place!

likes.liked: — The view from our window overlooking the terrace.
likes.disliked: — The handtowels... but that seems to be an Italian thing.

reviews.title: The Orto de' Medici Hotel, Florence
reviews.text: This medium-priced Hotel offers a very good price to service ratio. The rooms are very clean and being an old but refurbished building, it has high and well appointed rooms.The hotel offers - as a garni hotel - an excellent breakfast (self-service from two tables). Being not on a thoroughfare, it is quiet at night. Its situation in relation to the main attraction, the Piazza del Duomo, is a seven to ten minute's walk. There are plenty of restaurants in the vicinity, especially just opposite is the restaurant "Il Cardellino".

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: At the reception English and French is spoken. The service personnel is very friendly and is supervised by the proprietor himself.
reviews.title: very nice

likes.liked: — the people at reception, the dining room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The "Hopp on / Hopp-off Bus" can be taken from the Piazza San Marco, approximately 200 meters from the hotel Orto de' Medici, where also other regular bus lines part for the hinterland.
reviews.title: Comfortable welcoming hotel

likes.liked: — The terrace to sit and relax before and after a busy day

description: The Florence Hotel Orto de' Medici’s location is ideal because while located in the “historic center” of Florence it is just outside the noisy hustle and bustle…which is only a short walk away. When walking through our hotel in Florence, you really do feel like you are in a classic and upscale historic building. The front desk staff is very helpful and friendly, and from the moment you arrive you are made to feel very welcome. Each room is uniquely and elegantly appointed, a restful oasis for the busy traveler. The bathroom is very spacious and the shower is wonderful after a long day of sightseeing. Breakfast, with plenty to select from, is served in a cozy room that spills out into a welcoming patio and a beautiful little garden. The hotel lobby and reading rooms are a nice place to relax after a full day of sightseeing (plus free internet - either wifi or with brand new Apple computers).
